lines.gurmukhi: crn srin gur qIrQ purb koit dyvI dyv syv gur crin srn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Gur Teerad Purab Koti , Dayvee Dayv Sayv Gur Charani Saran Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Refuge of a True Guru is equivalent to pilgrimage of millions of holy places. Service of millions of gods and goddesses is also equivalent to living in the service of True Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: crn srin gur kwmnw skl Pl iriD isiD iniD Avqwr Amrn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Gur Kaamanaa Sakal Dhala , Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Avataar Amaran Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: All desires fructify in the holy refuge of True Guru. All the miraculous powers remain in attendance forever.

lines.gurmukhi: crn srin gur nwm inhkwm Dwm Bgiq jugiq kir qwrn qrn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Gur Naam Nihakaam Dhaama , Bhagati Jougati Kari Taaran Taran Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Meditation on Lord's name carried out in the refuge of the True Guru but with no reward at the back of the mind, is the place of all the comforts and peace in the world. A devoted Sikh absorbs himself in Naam Simran and sails across the worldly ocean besi

lines.gurmukhi: crn srin gur mihmw AgwiD boD hrn Brn giq kwrn krn hY ]72]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Gur Mahimaa Agaadhi Bodha , Haran Bharan Gati Kaaran Karan Hai ?72?

Shabad OS B.translation: The glory of the refuge of a True Guru is beyond perception. Like eternal Lord, it destroys all base deeds and vices and fills a person with virtues. (72)
